scope: Governs marriage and divorce among Hindus, Buddhists, Jains, and Sikhs

Section_5: Neither party has a spouse living at the time of marriage
Neither party is incapable of giving valid consent due to unsoundness of mind
Neither party has been subject to recurrent attacks of insanity
Bridegroom has completed 21 years, bride 18 years
Parties are not within prohibited degrees of relationship
Parties are not sapindas of each other

judicial_separation.Section_10: Same grounds as divorce, spouse can live separately

maintenance_and_alimony.Section_25: Court can grant alimony/expenses during proceedings
maintenance_and_alimony.Section_27: Court can grant maintenance to wife after divorce

custody_and_guardianship.Section_26: Court can pass orders for custody of children

procedure.jurisdiction: District Court where marriage solemnized or parties last resided
procedure.foreign_marriages: Section 4 - Applies to Hindus married outside India
